patch 1 overview this pattern is written using us crochet terminology it uses basic stitches but due to the small size is recommended for advanced beginner skill level and above you can use whatever yarn you like but all the samples were made using stylecraft special dk yarn and a 3 25mm hook the giant rabbit was made with the yarn doubled and a 4mm hook i used 7 5mm safety eyes though you could also embroider the eyes if you would like to make the tails fluffy or to make one of the fluffier breeds then you will also need a wire brush this pattern uses the same basic body shape for all the rabbits and i have included all the details to make the colour variations for the breeds shown in the cover photo the ears also change with the breed the head and body are worked as a continuous spiral the legs and tail are worked in row and the ears are made from crocheting onto the starting chain where colour changes are required these are best made by pulling the new colour through the last two loops of the previous stitch this means it is best to read through the pattern carefully so you are ready to make the colour changes abbreviations ● single_crochet single_crochet ● decrease decrease for best results use the invisible decrease for this put the front loops only of the next two stitches on the hook yarn over pull through these two loops yarn over and pull through all remaining loops ● increase increase by making two single_crochet in the next stitch ● slip_stitch slip_stitch ● half_double_crochet half_double_crochet ● double_crochet double_crochet ● m r magic_ring ● b s bobble stitch this is used to make the front legs yarn over insert hook through stitch yarn over and pull yarn through stitch yarn over and pull through two loops on hook repeat another three times there should be five loops on your hook yarn over and pull through all remaining loops on hook ● decrease single_crochet two together the invisible decrease works best for most of this pattern but the last stitch on the tail is made by single crocheting the next two stitches together © laura s pixie patch 2 european rabbit this is the basic body shape for all the patterns the legs and tail are also the same for each the sample here has been made to look like a havana black characterised by their glossy coats and dark claws head and body use black if making a havana black round 1 ​ make 6sc in m r 6 stitches round 2 ​ increase single_crochet three times 9 stitches round 3 ​ single_crochet increase single_crochet three times 12 stitches round 4 ​4sc increase 7sc 13 stitches round 5 ​ 10sc increase single_crochet increase 15 stitches round 6 ​
